curated_text: Symbol: WMT. Year: 2022. Period: Q3. ReportType: Q10. Section: Competition and Market Position. This section discusses competitors, market dynamics, and regulatory landscape.  Competitors mentioned: COVID-19, Walmart, Allocation of Capital Expenditures 2022, Walmart International, Total Capital Expenditures, Liquidity and Capital Resources, Return on Investment, ROA, Company, See Liquidity, Capital Resources, Consolidated, Sam's Club, Sam's Club eCommerce, Capital Resources Liquidity, Working Capital Deficit Cash, Flipkart, Financing Activities, Total Balances, the Board of Directors, Record Date Payable Date, the Company's Board of Directors, Standard & Poor's A-1+ AA Moody's Investors Service P-1, Consolidated Financial Statements, the Asda Equal Value, United States Federal Trade Commission, the Federal and State Prescription Opiate Litigation, I. Supplemental Information, the Foreign Direct Investment, the State of California in Part II, SEC, Legal Proceedings I. SUPPLEMENTAL, Prescription Opiate Litigation, National Prescription Opiate Litigation, MDL, District Court, the Cherokee Nation, the U.S. District Court, the District Court, the U.S., the U.S. Department of Justice, Walmart Inc., USDC, DE, DOJ, the United States Supreme Court, CSA, the Securities Exchange Act, the Chancery Court, Delaware Chancery Court, Ontario Provincial Council of Carpenters' Pension Trust Fund, DE Court of Chancery, Stanton v. Walmart Inc., Martin v. Walmart Inc., Ms S Brierley & Others, ASDA Stores Ltd, ASDA Stores Ltd v Brierley & Ors, ASDA Stores Ltd v, UKEAT/0059/16/DM - United Kingdom Employment Appeal Tribunal, the Directorate of Enforcement, Flipkart Private Limited, Foreign Direct Investment. Context excerpt: competition from other discount, department, drug, dollar, variety and specialty stores, warehouse clubs and supermarkets, as well as eCommerce businesses.  Many of these competitors are national, regional or international chains or have a national or international omni-channel or eCommerce presence.  We compete with a number of companies for attracting and retaining quality employees ("associates").  We, along with other retail companies, are influenced by a number of factors including, but not limited to: catastrophic events, weather and other risks related to climate change, global health epidemics, including the COVID-19 pandemic, competitive pressures, consumer disposable income, consumer debt levels and buying patterns, consumer credit availability, supply chain disruptions, cost and availability of goods, currency exchange rate fluctuations, customer preferences, deflation, inflation, fuel and energy prices, general economic conditions, insurance costs, interest rates, labor ava
